required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Alisporivir Alone or Combined With RBV or PEG in Chronic Hepatitis C Genotype 2 and 3 Treatment-naïve Participants
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Open Label, Parallel-group Phase IIB Study on the Efficacy and Safety of Oral Regimens of DEB025 Alone or in Combination With Ribavirin Versus Standard of Care (Peg-IFNα2a Plus Ribavirin) in Treatment-naïve Hepatitis C Genotype 2 and 3 Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The study is to investigate whether alisporivir (ALV; DEB025) alone or in combination with either ribavirin (RBV) or peginterferon alfa-2a (PEG) is more efficient compared to standard of care (PEG+RBV) in treatment-naïve participants with hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype 2 and 3. In addition, triple therapy with DEB025 plus standard of care will be applied to participants not achieving rapid viral response (RVR) in the different arms.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Rapid Viral Response (RVR) After 4 Weeks of Treatment < the Limit of Quantification (RVR4LOQ)
primary_outcome.description: RVR4LOQ was defined as RVR [serum hepatitis C virus (HCV) ribonucleic acid (RNA) < the limit of quantification (LOQ), i.e., < 25 IU/mL], after 4 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With RVR After 4 Weeks of Treatment < the Limit of Detection (RVR4LOD)
secondary_outcome.description: RVR4LOD was defined as Rapid Viral Response (RVR) [serum HCV RNA < the limit of detection (LOD), i.e., < 10 IU/mL], after 4 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With RVR4LOQ and RVR4LOD (Genotype 2)
Percentage of Participants With RVR4LOQ and RVR4LOD (Genotype 3)
Percentage of Participants With Complete Early Viral Response (cEVR) After 12 Weeks of Treatment (cEVR12LOQ and cEVR12LOD)
secondary_outcome.description: cEVR12LOQ and cEVR12LOD were defined as cEVR [serum HCV RNA < LOQ and < LOD] after 12 weeks of treatment, respectively.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With cEVR12LOQ and cEVR12LOD (Genotype 2)
Percentage of Participants With cEVR12LOQ and cEVR12LOD (Genotype 3)
Percentage of Participants With End of Treatment Response (ETR) Within 24 Weeks (ETR24LOQ and ETR24LOD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at end of treatment, within 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: ETR24LOQ and ETR24LOD were defined as ETR [serum HCV RNA < LOQ and < LOD] after 24 weeks of treatment or when prematurely discontinued.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With ETR24LOQ and ETR24LOD (Genotype 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at end of treatment, within 24 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With ETR24LOQ and ETR24LOD (Genotype 3)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at end of treatment, within 24 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With RVR Who Achieved Sustained Viral Response (SVR) 12 Weeks After the End of Treatment (SVR12LOQ and SVR12LOD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: SVR12LOQ and SVR12LOD were defined as Sustained Viral Response (SVR) [serum HCV RNA < LOQ and < LOD] 12 weeks after treatment, respectively.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With RVR Who Achieved SVR12LOQ and SVR12LOD (Genotype 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the end of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With RVR Who Achieved SVR12LOQ and SVR12LOD (Genotype 3)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the end of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With RVR Who Achieved SVR at 24 Weeks After the End of Treatment (SVR24LOQ and SVR24LOD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks after the end of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With RVR Who Achieved SVR24LOQ and SVR24LOD (Genotype 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks after the end of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With RVR Who Achieved SVR24LOQ and SVR24LOD (Genotype 3)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks after the end of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With On-treatment Viral Breakthrough
secondary_outcome.description: Viral breakthrough was defined as either: Confirmed increase of HCV RNA ≥1 log10 above nadir (nadir = lowest HCV RNA value during treatment), or HCV RNA becoming ≥ 100 IU/mL after previously being undetectable (< LOD) during treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Viral Relapse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 24 weeks after the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Viral relapse was defined as having reappearance of detectable HCV RNA after previously being undetectable (< LOD) during treatment.

arm_group.description: Alisporivir (ALV) 600 mg twice daily (BID) for 1 week, followed by ALV 1000 mg once daily (QD) during Weeks 2 to 24.
Alisporivir (ALV) 600 mg BID with RBV for 1 week, followed by ALV 600 mg QD with ribavirin (RBV) during Weeks 2 to 24.
Alisporivir (ALV) 600 mg BID with RBV for 1 week, followed by ALV 800 mg QD with RBV during Weeks 2 to 24.
Alisporivir (ALV) 600 mg BID with Peginterferon alfa-2a (PEG) for 1 week, followed by ALV 600 mg QD with PEG once weekly during Weeks 2 to 24.
Peginterferon alfa-2a (PEG) and RBV during Weeks 1 to 24.

intervention.description: ALV 200 mg soft gel capsules administered orally
PEG 180 μg administered via subcutaneous (s.c.) injection once weekly
RBV 400 mg (2 x 200 mg tablets) administered orally twice daily (BID)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Chronic hepatitis C viral infection
- Plasma HCV RNA level lower limit ≥ 10,000 IU/ml assessed by quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) or equivalent at screening (no upper limit)
- HCV genotype 2 or 3
- No previous treatment for hepatitis C infection
Exclusion criteria:
- Evidence of cirrhosis at the time of screening
- Evidence of hepatocellular carcinoma at the time of screening
- Any other cause of relevant liver disease other than HCV
- Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) ≥ 10 times upper limit of normal (ULN)
- Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply

facility.name: The Office of Dr. Claudia Martorell

results_reference.citation: Pawlotsky JM, Flisiak R, Sarin SK, Rasenack J, Piratvisuth T, Chuang WL, Peng CY, Foster GR, Shah S, Wedemeyer H, Hézode C, Zhang W, Wong KA, Li B, Avila C, Naoumov NV; VITAL-1 study team. Alisporivir plus ribavirin, interferon free or in combination with pegylated interferon, for hepatitis C virus genotype 2 or 3 infection. Hepatology. 2015 Oct;62(4):1013-23. doi: 10.1002/hep.27960. Epub 2015 Aug 10.

group.title: ALV 800 mg+RBV
group.description: ALV 600 mg BID with RBV for 1 week, followed by ALV 800 mg QD with RBV during Weeks 2 to 24.

group.title: ALV 600 mg+PEG
group.description: ALV 600 mg BID with PEG for 1 week, followed by ALV 600 mg QD with PEG during Weeks 2 to 24.

group.title: PEG+RBV
group.description: PEG and RBV during Weeks 1 to 24.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With On-treatment Viral Breakthrough
measure.description: Viral breakthrough was defined as either: Confirmed increase of HCV RNA ≥1 log10 above nadir (nadir = lowest HCV RNA value during treatment), or HCV RNA becoming ≥ 100 IU/mL after previously being undetectable (< LOD) during treatment

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Viral Relapse
outcome.description: Viral relapse was defined as having reappearance of detectable HCV RNA after previously being undetectable (< LOD) during treatment.
outcome.time_frame: within 24 weeks after the end of treatment

group.title: ALV 1000 mg
group.description: ALV 600 mg BID for 1 week, followed by ALV 1000 mg QD during Weeks 2 to 24.

measure.description: Viral relapse was defined as having reappearance of detectable HCV RNA after previously being undetectable (< LOD) during treatment.

class.title: 0 to 12 weeks after the end of treatment
12 to 24 weeks after the end of treatment

group.title: ALV 1000 mg: On-treatment AEs
group.description: Adverse events (AEs) occurring while on treatment in participants receiving ALV 600 mg BID for 1 week, followed by ALV 1000 mg QD during Weeks 2 to 24.

group.title: ALV 600 mg+RBV: On-treatment AEs
group.description: AEs occurring while on treatment in participants receiving ALV 600 mg BID with RBV for 1 week, followed by ALV 600 mg QD with RBV during Weeks 2 to 24.

group.title: ALV 800 mg+RBV: On-treatment AEs
group.description: AEs occurring while on treatment in participants receiving ALV 600 mg BID with RBV for 1 week, followed by ALV 800 mg QD with RBV during Weeks 2 to 24.

group.title: ALV 600 mg+PEG: On-treatment AEs
group.description: AEs occurring while on treatment in participants receiving ALV 600 mg BID with PEG for 1 week, followed by ALV 600 mg QD with PEG during Weeks 2 to 24.

group.title: PEG+RBV: On-treatment AEs
group.description: AEs occurring while on treatment in participants receiving PEG and RBV during Weeks 1 to 24.

group.title: ALV 1000 mg: Post-treatment AEs
group.description: AEs occurring after end of treatment in participants receiving ALV 600 mg BID for 1 week, followed by ALV 1000 mg QD during Weeks 2 to 24.

group.description: AEs occurring after end of treatment in participants receiving ALV 600 mg BID with RBV for 1 week, followed by ALV 600 mg QD with RBV during Weeks 2 to 24.

group.description: AEs occurring after end of treatment in participants receiving ALV 600 mg BID with RBV for 1 week, followed by ALV 800 mg QD with RBV during Weeks 2 to 24.

group.description: AEs occurring after end of treatment in participants receiving ALV 600 mg BID with PEG for 1 week, followed by ALV 600 mg QD with PEG during Weeks 2 to 24.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
